products.facilitation_text: We facilitate access to data so that the distance
products.analysis_distance: between you and an analysis is
products.search_as_you_want: Search for data as you wish
products.search_description: There are several filters to help you find the data you need. As you navigate through hundreds of datasets available on the platform, you can refine your search by theme, organization, time coverage, observation level, and more.
products.processed_tables_description: With the processed tables in our data lake, you no longer need to spend hours cleaning data. Our standardization methodology allows you to easily cross-reference data from different organizations. This way, you can focus on what really matters.
products.packages_description: We have developed packages for accessing processed data in Python, R, and command line. Additionally, you can query and filter data using SQL in our public data lake editor on Google BigQuery.

support.existence_through_effort: We exist through the effort of people who

support.enthusiast_description: day to help us maintain the initiative.
support.master_of_data_description: Less than R$2 per day to save you even more work.

tooltip.discordCommunity: Talk to our community on Discord

fernando.name: Fernando Barbalho
fernando.position: Data Scientist at the National Treasury
fernando.quote: SiconfiBD is a package that quickly and programmatically brings data from the National Treasury Secretariat. The code is built open-source by the Treasury team and uses DB tables to compose functions in R. What is the personnel expense of the 100 most populous Brazilian municipalities? These and more than 18 other questions can be consulted directly through the package, without the need for SQL.

marina.name: Marina Barros
marina.quote: With the support of Data Basis, we conducted a survey of gender and race inequalities in the 2016-2020 elections and the distortions in campaign financing for female mayors and councilors in the last elections, which will result in the launch of an unprecedented publication.

amanda.name: Amanda de Albuquerque and Mariana Carvalho
amanda.quote: We created an important product of ours, the Municipality Photograph, in partnership with DB. The Photograph aggregates various socioeconomic indicators of Brazilian municipalities. A Ponte did the planning and design of the report, while DB took care of the technical part of data visualization and management. The partnership allowed us to advance quickly in the development of the tool and ensured the high data quality we wanted from the beginning.
